code: @Manual{,   title = {ExclusionTable: Creating Tables of Excluded Observations},   author = {Joshua P. Entrop},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.1.0.9000,     https://entjos.github.io/ExclusionTable/},   url = {https://github.com/entjos/ExclusionTable/}, }

title: Creating Tables of Excluded Observations
text: package provides exclusion table R can keeping track inclusion exclusion criteria apply datasets. Using exclusion_table() function can obtain table listing number excluded observation inclusion exclusion criteria. Additionally, use option keep_data == TRUE can also obtain dataset without excluded observations.

title: Creating Tables of Excluded Observations
text: quick example illustrate ExclusionTable offers. use penguins dataset included palmerpenguins package example. make sure install package running example . code produces following table, offers nice overview number observations removed dataset exclusion criteria. Please take look vigniett website information use ExclusionTable package.
code: # Load Penguine dataset library(palmerpenguins)  # Apply some exclusions exclusion_table(penguins,                 exclusion_criteria = c("year == 2007",                                        "sex  == 'male'",                                        "bill_length_mm <= 40 &                                        !is.na(bill_length_mm)"),                 labels_exclusion   = c("Measured in 2007",                                        "Males",                                        "Bill length <= 40mm")) ================================================ Excluded the following observations: ================================================ Exclusions based on EXCLUSION criteria              exclusion n_prior n_post n_excluded 1    Measured in 2007     344    234        110 2               Males     234    114        120 3 Bill length <= 40mm     114     66         48 4               TOTAL     344     66        278  ================================================

title: Creating Tables of Excluded Observations
text: can download latest release package CRAN using install.packages(ExclusionTable) latest development version using remotes.

title: Creating Tables of Excluded Observations
text: find bugs suggestions please don’t hesitate file issue GitHub.

title: Exclusion Table — exclusion_table
text: function keeps track many observations exclude using specific inclusion exclusion criteria. assumes criteria logical filter statements, .e. statements pass dplyr::filter() {data.table}.

title: Exclusion Table — exclusion_table
code: exclusion_table(   data = NULL,   inclusion_criteria = NULL,   exclusion_criteria = NULL,   labels_inclusion = inclusion_criteria,   labels_exclusion = exclusion_criteria,   obj = NULL,   keep_data = TRUE,   id = NULL )

title: Exclusion Table — exclusion_table
text: data dataframe exclusions performed. inclusion_criteria character vector logical expressions used inclusions. individuals meet criteria included. Specifically, observations logical expression FALSE excluded. Please keep mind expression handle NA values. exclusion_criteria character vector logical expressions used exclusions. observations meet criteria excluded. Specifically, observations logical expression TRUE excluded. Please keep mind expression handle NA values. labels_inclusion optional character vector labels used label steps inclusions. default labels logical expressions passed inclusion_criteria labels_exclusion optional character vector labels used label steps exclusions. default labels logical expressions passed exclusion_criteria. obj named list objects passed filtering call. list can access using obj$<name object> filtering call. keep_data logical statement indicate whether new dataset without excluded observations outputted. default TRUE. id Optional name unique ID variable dataset.

title: Exclusion Table — exclusion_table
text: exclusion_table returns exl_tbl object list data frames including following information: table_in data.frame including number observations excluded inclusion criteria listed inclusion_criteria. table_ex data.frame including number observations excluded exclusion criteria listed exclusion_criteria. dataset data.frame supplied dataset applying inclusion exclusion criteria. id supplied, additional column added table_in table_ex including list IDs excluded dataset step.

title: Exclusion Table — exclusion_table
code: #Example without using the obj argument exclusion_table(    data = mtcars,    exclusion_criteria = c("disp <= 70 | disp >= 300",                           "as.character(gear) == '4'"),    labels_exclusion   = c("First exclusion",                           "Second exclusion") ) #>  #> ============================================= #> Excluded the following observations: #> ============================================= #> Exclusions based on EXCLUSION criteria #>  #>          exclusion n_prior n_post n_excluded #> 1  First exclusion      32     21         11 #> 2 Second exclusion      21      9         12 #> 3            TOTAL      32      9         23 #>  #> ============================================= #>   #Example using the obj argument my_selection <- c(8, 6)  exclusion_table(   data = mtcars,   exclusion_criteria = c("cyl %in% my_selection"),   labels_exclusion   = c("First exclusion"),   obj = list(my_selection = my_selection) ) #> Error in eval(parse(text = filter_string)): object 'my_selection' not found

title: Prints exl_tbl objects — print.exl_tbl
text: print function exl_tbl objects, created exlcusion_table(). function improves readability output.

title: Prints exl_tbl objects — print.exl_tbl
text: x exl_tbl object. ... arguments passed print.
